title: VMware as a Service docs
introduction: IBM Cloud for VMware as a Service is an IBM Cloud offering that deploys a comprehensive portfolio of automated and on-demand services for VMware workloads to the cloud. Learn how to make the most of your VMware as a Service experience by using the docs.

section_recommended.title: Getting started with VMware as a Service
section_recommended.description: Get familiar with the process of ordering a VMware as a Service instance.

section_recommended.title: Planning the deployment
section_recommended.description: Ensure that you plan your deployment properly.

section_recommended.title: Ordering instances
section_recommended.description: You can order a VMware as a Service instance.

section_recommended.title: Adding hosts
section_recommended.description: You can increase or decrease the capacity of your deployment.

section_recommended.title: Adding virtual data centers
section_recommended.description: You can deploy one or more virtual data centers.

section_recommended.title: Viewing instances
section_recommended.description: You can view the information of the instances that are provisioned for your account.

tiles.title: Data center support for 25 GbE
tiles.description: You can select a data center with networking speed of either 10 GbE or 25 GbE.

tiles.title: Multiple clusters support
tiles.description: The limitation of one cluster per provider virtual data center is removed.

tiles.title: Multizone support
tiles.description: You can create provider virtual data centers across three data centers in the region.
